name: The Gateway Hotel Church Road

reviews.text: It was a quiet and calm stay with family to celebrate my mothers birthday. Although we had a good time sitting on the lovely garden, enjoying the fireplace both inside the room and outside in the lawns at night, the F&B was a tad bit boring - not too much choice for the regular traveller. Im sure that foreigners would be quite happy with the indian choices, as they were the regular dishes - not great value for the Taj brand.
reviews.title: Good hotel but F&B not good

reviews.text: location of the hotel and its setting makes you feel one with nature. it has small cottage like rooms with small gardens and loads of trees around. They have game room,campfire and yoga sessions. A taj property with a difference. We loved conoor more than ooty.
reviews.title: tranquility with nature

reviews.text: Very Good hotel for a week of relaxation. Best Value for Money.
reviews.title: Amazing Getaway

reviews.text: This is a pretty good hotel, the lawns are very well maintained and the scenery is pleasing.

reviews.text: After numerous stays in Ooty, we wanted to explore a new property in the twin town of Coonor which is just about 10 miles from Ooty. We drove down to this home stay kind of hotel which has been branded and refurnished as a hill hotel with wooden interiors and exteriors. This property was as it seems an erstwhile hill bungalow with numerous cottages and these have been very remotely refurnished to adhere to some level of standards that Taj exhuberates.
reviews.title: Exploring new hills stays

reviews.text: The property is a small walk from the middle of the Coonor market and the service is a little slacky. The rooms are not very great but has some wonderful views of the garden and the hills. The food is average but nothing of great delight.
reviews.title: Very relaxing place

reviews.title: Great place in the hills

reviews.text: Be sure to travel by car as the hotel has a safe parking facility but the area doesn’t have any other means of transport. The rooms are clean, spacious and aesthetically designed with a cozy fire-place (which can be used), wooden flooring and housed under a tiled roof-top. Moderately, value for money (decided to stay elsewhere on my next trip), the facility is good with table tennis, indoor games, a neat lawn for a quiet tea-time snack and a good restaurant. Located close to SIMS park but far from Ooty, this place is not for sight-seers but those who want a quiet getaway at a cool hill-station.
reviews.title: A peaceful getaway

reviews.text: Location: The hotel is not very close from the city center and if you are coming from the bus stand, you will easily miss out the hotel as the display board comes to the rear end. The entrance to the gate can be scary in the evenings, as one side is the graveyard!
reviews.title: Beautiful property - Wish Taj would spend some money on it.

reviews.text: We stayed the hotel for 3 nights. It is located in a good area and surrunded by beautiful flowers and nature. The room was antique style and lovely. The room was bit dump,but I did not mind it too much.
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere and friendly

reviews.text: The food at hotel was quite good. We ate there all the stay as we have a small baby. Every time we went to the hotel, the staff asked us if we need any food for baby and they normally cook something I asked which was really helpful.
reviews.title: nice getaway

reviews.text: The hotel taxi was more expensive than outside cab, so we checked the taxi company in coimbatore on the internet and used it. The drive was about 2hours-2 and half hours.
reviews.title: wow

reviews.text: Most of staffs were nice, but some of receptionist know nothing. So we asked the hotel manager who was very helpful.
reviews.title: Back to nature! the gateway was a true get away!

reviews.text: I had ayurveda massage. The massage lady was really good and it was not so exspensive. I have done ayurveda massage many times including kerala. But I can say that she was one of the best.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

description: Nestled In the heart of rolling mountains and drifting mists, guests at The Gateway Hotel find it easy to lose themselves in the beauty of soothing views and exotic surroundings. No two rooms are alike at this historic hotel with old world charm. An artful blend of colonial architecture and contemporary amenities ensures that guests will find their stay here to be a relaxing experience
